content.introduction:
Checks for common roundabout ways to express 
starts_with
 and 
ends_with

and suggests replacing with the simpler method when it is available. Notably,
this will work with 
std::string
 and 
std::string_view
.

Covered scenarios:

Expression


Replacement




u.find(v)
 
==
 
0


u.starts_with(v)




u.find(v,
 
0)
 
==
 
0


u.starts_with(v)




u.find(v,
 
0,
 
v.size())
 
==
 
0


u.starts_with(v)




u.rfind(v,
 
0)
 
!=
 
0


!u.starts_with(v)




u.rfind(v,
 
0,
 
v.size())
 
!=
 
0


!u.starts_with(v)




u.compare(0,
 
v.size(),
 
v)
 
==
 
0


u.starts_with(v)




u.substr(0,
 
v.size())
 
==
 
v


u.starts_with(v)




v
 
!=
 
u.substr(0,
 
v.size())


!u.starts_with(v)




u.compare(u.size()
 
-
 
v.size(),
 
v.size(),
 
v)
 
==
 
0


u.ends_with(v)




u.rfind(v)
 
==
 
u.size()
 
-
 
v.size()


u.ends_with(v)
